quantityRules.description: Single gecko requires 10 gallons minimum (20Ã—10Ã—12 inches). Each additional female requires 5 more gallons. Never house males together.

setupTips: Provide three hides: warm side, cool side, and moist hide for shedding
Use under-tank heating pad with thermostat on warm side
Avoid loose substrates - use tile, paper towels, or reptile carpet
notes: Nocturnal and crepuscular - most active at dawn and dusk
Docile temperament makes them excellent for beginners
Can drop their tail when stressed (will regrow but won't look the same)

warnings.message: Never use heat rocks - they cause severe burns. Use under-tank heating pad with thermostat only.
Avoid sand and other loose substrates which can cause impaction if ingested during feeding

feedingRequirements: Insectivorous diet - crickets, mealworms, dubia roaches
Dust with calcium and D3 supplement
feedingSchedule: Juveniles (0-6 months): Daily feeding, 5-8 appropriately-sized insects
Sub-adults (7-12 months): Every other day, 6-10 insects
waterNotes: Provide shallow water dish at all times
Keep water dish on cool side to prevent evaporation
mistingNotes: Minimal misting needed - keep humidity low (30-40%)
Provide moist hide with damp sphagnum moss for shedding
Light misting of moist hide only during shedding
